derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting a curve or circuit, hence later a ‘turn’ of activity): from dialect bought 'bend, loop'; probably of Low German origin

entry.def: If you have a bout of an illness or of an unpleasant feeling, you have it for a short period.

example.ex: He was recovering from a severe bout of flu...
example.tran: 他患了严重的流感，尚未痊愈。

example.ex: I was suffering with a bout of nerves.

entry.tran: （不愉快之事大量发生的）一阵，一小段时间
entry.def: A bout of something that is unpleasant is a short time during which it occurs a great deal.

example.ex: The latest bout of violence has claimed twenty four lives...
example.tran: 最近发生的一起暴力事件造成24人死亡。

example.ex: A half-hour daily walk can be more beneficial than one hard bout of exercise a week.
example.tran: 每天散步半小时会比一周剧烈运动一次对身体更有益。

entry.def: A bout is a boxing or wrestling match.

example.ex: This will be his eighth title bout in 19 months.
example.tran: 这将是他19个月里的第8次卫冕赛。

entry.tran: （当about的第一个音节不发音时，有些作家以’bout或bout替代about）
entry.def: Some writers use  'bout or bout to represent about when the first syllable is not pronounced.

example.ex: I just felt the need to write bout it, I guess.
example.tran: 我想我就是觉得有必要对此写点儿什么。

means.word_mean: 1. (sports) a period of play during which one team is on the offensive

sentences.sentence: "the fight was on television last night"

means.word_mean: 3. an occasion for excessive eating or drinking;

sentences.sentence: "they went on a bust that lasted three days"
